column4: alright... anybody... I'm trying to connect via tightvnc to vncserver on my ubuntu server box... can't. It worked prior to a restart. Suggestions?
how can I start it from the command line? honestly... I did an apt-get and no idea how it works... it's just "magic" ;-)
ideally... I don't want xserver running on a regular basis underpowered development box
not that I have ever done this, but don't you ssh onto your server, start X which then starts the vncserver, you use the vnc client and off you go?
this is a first time for me as well...
that was an interesting read... but ultimately... not really what I'm looking for...
it seems that remote desktop only works if somebody is logged in... but I want it to function that it logs in when somebody connects.
you want a script to copy logs over so you can look at them?
the goal is simply to be able to use the GUI remotely (from another computer)
I don't want to have to leave a window manager running...
when you ssh into your server you can start X and the vnc server correct?
